text.__SUMMARY__: Gymnopilus abramsii is a species of mushroom in the family Strophariaceae. It was first described by American mycologist Murrill in 1917. The epithet abramsii commemorates LeRoy Abrams.
text.Description: The cap is 4 to 6 cm (1.6 to 2.4 in) in diameter.
text.Habitat and distribution: Found in California, Gymnopilus abramsii grows on soil, and typically fruits in November.
